alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 5:26AM MST until July 27 at 8:30AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Arizona, including the following county, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 830 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area with rainfall rates up to one and half inches per hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Casa Grande, Coolidge, Queen Creek, Arizona City, Arizola, Olberg, San Tan Mountain Park, Sacaton, Santan and Stanfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
